verses.text_plain: Then Job answered and said,
verses.verse_html: 1Then Job answered and said,

verses.text_plain: How long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?
verses.verse_html: 2How long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?

verses.text_plain: These ten times have ye reproached me: ye are not ashamed that ye make yourselves strange to me.
verses.verse_html:
3These ten times have ye reproached me: ye are not ashamed that ye make yourselves strange to me. ▼
▼ make…: or, harden yourselves against me

footnotes.body_text: ▼ make…: or, harden yourselves against me
footnotes.body_html: ▼ make…: or, harden yourselves against me

verses.text_plain: And be it indeed that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.
verses.verse_html: 4And be it indeed that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.

verses.text_plain: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach:
verses.verse_html: 5If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach:

verses.text_plain: Know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.
verses.verse_html: 6Know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.

verses.text_plain: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.
verses.verse_html:
7Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but there is no judgment. ▼
▼ wrong: or, violence

verses.text_plain: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
verses.verse_html: 8He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.

verses.text_plain: He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.
verses.verse_html: 9He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.

verses.text_plain: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.
verses.verse_html: 10He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.

verses.text_plain: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.
verses.verse_html: 11He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.

verses.text_plain: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.
verses.verse_html: 12His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.

verses.text_plain: He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.
verses.verse_html: 13He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.

verses.text_plain: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.
verses.verse_html: 14My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.

verses.text_plain: They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.
verses.verse_html: 15They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.

verses.text_plain: I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I intreated him with my mouth.
verses.verse_html: 16I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I intreated him with my mouth.

verses.text_plain: My breath is strange to my wife, though I intreated for the children’s sake of mine own body.
verses.verse_html:
17My breath is strange to my wife, though I intreated for the children’s sake of mine own body. ▼
▼ mine…: Heb. my belly

footnotes.body_html: ▼ mine…: Heb. my belly

verses.text_plain: Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me.
verses.verse_html:
18Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me. ▼
▼ young…: or, the wicked

footnotes.body_html: ▼ young…: or, the wicked

verses.text_plain: All my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me.
verses.verse_html:
19All my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me. ▼
▼ my…: Heb. the men of my secret

tokens.text: me: and they whom I loved

footnotes.body_text: ▼ my…: Heb. the men of my secret
footnotes.body_html: ▼ my…: Heb. the men of my secret

verses.text_plain: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.
verses.verse_html:
20My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth. ▼
▼ and to: or, as to

footnotes.body_html: ▼ and to: or, as to

verses.text_plain: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.
verses.verse_html: 21Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.

tokens.text: upon me, O ye my friends

verses.text_plain: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?
verses.verse_html: 22Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?

verses.text_plain: Oh that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book!
verses.verse_html:
23Oh that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book! ▼
▼ Oh…: Heb. Who will give, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Oh…: Heb. Who will give, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Oh…: Heb. Who will give, etc

verses.text_plain: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!
verses.verse_html: 24That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!

verses.text_plain: For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth:
verses.verse_html: 25For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth:

verses.text_plain: And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God:
verses.verse_html:
26And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God: ▼
▼ And…: or, After I shall awake, though this body be destroyed, yet out of my flesh

footnotes.body_text: ▼ And…: or, After I shall awake, though this body be destroyed, yet out of my flesh
footnotes.body_html: ▼ And…: or, After I shall awake, though this body be destroyed, yet out of my flesh

verses.text_plain: Whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another; though my reins be consumed within me.
verses.verse_html:
27Whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another; though my reins be consumed within me. ▼
▼ another: Heb. a stranger
 , ▼
▼ though…: or, my reins within me are consumed with earnest desire (for that day)
 , ▼
▼ within…: Heb. in my bosom

footnotes.body_html: ▼ another: Heb. a stranger

footnotes.body_text: ▼ though…: or, my reins within me are consumed with earnest desire (for that day)
footnotes.body_html: ▼ though…: or, my reins within me are consumed with earnest desire (for that day)
▼ within…: Heb. in my bosom

verses.text_plain: But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?
verses.verse_html:
28But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me? ▼
▼ seeing…: or, and what root of matter is found in me?

footnotes.body_text: ▼ seeing…: or, and what root of matter is found in me?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ seeing…: or, and what root of matter is found in me?

verses.text_plain: Be ye afraid of the sword: for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.
verses.verse_html: 29Be ye afraid of the sword: for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.
